title: How to Close Apps on iPhone With and Without a Home Button

steps.title: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle.
steps.content: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle. Release your finger when the apps open in preview-form. [1] X Research source Your iPhone must be unlocked and open to the Home Screen or an app. This method will work on iPhones without a Home button.

steps.title: Swipe to the app you want to close.
steps.content: Swipe to the app you want to close. You can swipe left and right to search through all open apps.

steps.title: Swipe up on the app.
steps.content: Swipe up on the app. This will close the app. Closing buggy apps usually fixes it upon the next launch. If your iPhone is frozen , try closing all the apps before restarting it .

steps.title: Double-click the Home button.
steps.content: Double-click the Home button. This is the circle button at the bottom of the iPhone. You'll see apps open in preview-form. Your iPhone must be unlocked and open to the Home Screen or an app. If your Home button is broken, you'll need to enable AssistiveTouch. Go to Settings → Accessibility → Touch → AssistiveTouch → toggle on AssistiveTouch . Tap the circle that appears on the screen to open the menu. Double-tap Home .

steps.title: Swipe to the app you want to close.
steps.content: Swipe to the app you want to close. You can swipe left and right to search through all open apps.

steps.title: Swipe up on the app.
steps.content: Swipe up on the app. This will close the app. If you want to keep a lot of apps open, you can save battery by disabling Background App Refresh .
